channel.title: Links on Bruno Scopelliti
channel.description: Recent content in Links on Bruno Scopelliti

item.title: What is JavaScript?
item.description: I am really impressed here with Kyle’s ability to summarize a topic. What is JavaScript? JavaScript is an implementation of the ECMAScript standard (version ES2019 as of this writing), which is guided by the TC39 committee and hosted by ECMA. It runs in browsers and other JS environments such as Node.js. JavaScript is a multi-paradigm language, meaning the syntax and capabilities allow a developer to mix and match (and bend and reshape!

item.title: The art of controlling complexity
item.description: From Eloquent Javascript, by Marijn Haverbeke. Keeping programs under control is the main problem of programming. When a program works, it is beautiful. The art of programming is the skill of controlling complexity. Just a reminder, primarily for myself. As developers we not only have to solve problems, but do it in a way we do not harm our future-self.
